message: You approach a tavern, the sign on the door reads: The Savoury Salmon. It seems humble, but reasonably well-kept.
A middle-aged woman smiles at you from behind the bar, two old men sit bickering at a nearby table.

dialogue.message: Of course, I'm afraid the selection's a bit limited at the moment due to all the bandit attacks, so we've got ale, or ale

options.text: Actually, I don't really like ale

message: The barkeep smiles warmly as you stand at the bar

dialogue.message: What can I do for you?

message: She points towards the two old man at the table

dialogue.message: Well if it's rumours you're looking for, those two over there are always spouting off tall tales, need anything else?

message: It's not the best ale you've ever had, but it's certainly drinkable

dialogue.message: Anything else I can get for you?

message: You approach a pair of equally toothless old men who appear to be arguing about the disappearance of someone named "One-eyed Jack"

dialogue.message: I tells ya, it's that damn harpy that's taken ol' One-eyed Jack, bandits would've captu#ff9c9c him and sent a ransom note

You're crazy, no bandit round 'ere has ever sent a ransom note, you know damn well no one round 'ere's got any money, least of all to buy Jack back. He's buried in a shallow grave in the woods somewhere, or fed to the dogs.

options.text: Agree that it probably is a harpy
Agree that it must be bandits

message: The first old man nods his head approvingly, whilst the other splutters in disbelief

dialogue.message: Now you just listen here, if you go off into them there woods and find a harpy, come back and I'll buy you a round my damn self

options.text: Sounds a bit too dangerous for me

message: The second old man nods his head approvingly, whilst the other splutters in disbelief

dialogue.message: Now you just listen here, if you go off into them there woods and find a harpy, come back and I'll buy you a round my damn self

options.text: Sounds a bit too dangerous for me

dialogue.message: This feller One-eye Jack went into the woods recently, to hunt down the harpy that took his eye and he's not come back since the harpy's done ate 'im.
Ignore him, that harpy took his eye years ago, it's long gone by now. We've been havin' trouble with bandits the last few weeks, and it's them that done ol' Jack in, the poor fool.

options.text: Agree that it probably is a harpy
Agree that it must be bandits

message: The barkeep is nowhere to be seen, but you can hear and smell bacon frying from a back-room. The old men look at you expectantly.

options.text: Speak to the old men again

message: You approach the two old men

dialogue.message: C'mon, you can't have forgotten what to do already? Go inna the woods and find out what happened to One-eyed Jack.
If you come back in one piece we'll pay ya.

message: You step out onto the street, one direction leads into the nearby woods, the other to a ramshackle little building with a sign out front saying "Genral Stoar"
A small weaselly man gives a start as you walk through the door

dialogue.message: Oh, t-t-terribly sorry, b-but I'm afraid we're c-c-closed, there's been too many b-b-b-bandit attacks lately and n-not enough caravans have come through with stock

message: You trot up the dusty path towards the woods and are stuck with a strange feeling that this is the start of quite the adventure....

dialogue.message: Ah, sorry, but you don't have enough money

options.text: Know of any rumours around here?
